verbs.description: outgallop (third-person singular simple present outgallops, present participle outgalloping, simple past and past participle outgalloped)

entries.meaning: (transitive, especially of horses or riders) To run faster than; to outdistance.
examples: He had lately procured himself a large, fine, mettlesome, Donets horse, dun-colored, with light mane and tail, and when he rode it no one could outgallop him.
